stem: The nurse is removing a Foley catheter from a client. Place the steps in the correct order.

options.text: Gently and slowly pull the catheter out of the urethra.
Insert a 10-mL syringe into the balloon inflation port and allow the water to drain by gravity.
Wash hands and don clean gloves.
Instruct the client to take a deep breath.
Perform perineal care and monitor for the first void.

rationale.correct: Safe catheter removal prevents urethral trauma. (1) Cleanliness. (2) Deflating the balloon is the most critical step; pulling an inflated balloon will tear the urethra. (3) Deep breath promotes relaxation. (4) Smooth withdrawal. (5) Aftercare and verification of bladder function.
rationale.incorrect: Using a needle to pop the balloon or cutting the tubing is not the standard method and can lead to balloon fragment retention.
clinicalPearls: Instruct the client that slight burning during the first few voids after removal is common, but they must report a total inability to void.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: If you meet resistance during removal, STOP. Re-attach the syringe and check for more fluid in the balloon. Never use force.

reviewUnits.heading: Catheter-Associated Urinary Tract Infection (CAUTI) Prevention
reviewUnits.body: Daily assessment of the need for the catheter is required. Removal should be performed as soon as the clinical indication is gone.
